properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 2:36AM PST until January 17 at 2:00AM PST by NWS San Diego CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches,
with localized amounts up to 6 inches, are expected. There will
also be areas of southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 55
mph which will cause blowing and drifting of snow.

* WHERE...San Bernardino County mountain areas above 5500 feet.

* WHEN...6 PM Thursday to 2 AM Friday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for reduced visibilities at
times in fog and blowing snow.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will
cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered
roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving.

For road condition information in California...enter
8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or
9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THURSDAY TO 2 AM PST FRIDAY ABOVE 5500 FEET
